title: LLM Tools for UX Researchers
description: Explored how large language models can help UX researchers understand hard-to-reach user populations through synthetic data generation and analysis. Conducted UX research on designing tools and workflows for researchers working with AI-generated insights to complement traditional methods.

title: Little Match Girl MR Experience
description: Visual storytelling experience where players traverse between real and virtual worlds through interaction with live actors in passthrough mode. Responsible for audio design and integrated FMOD (self-learned in 2 days), creating adaptive soundscapes that responded to player transitions between realities.

title: Breathe Deep
description: Global Game Jam Pittsburgh submission that won Jammer's Award. Worked as programmer and technical sound designer, implementing bubble mechanics and integrating FMOD for adaptive audio. Collaborated with 2 programmers, 2 artists, and a sound designer in 48-hour sprint.

title: Mental Health Dashboard
description: Designed biweekly workplace dashboard to alleviate mental health stigma through normalized check-ins and accessible resources. Conducted user research to understand employee needs, created information architecture, and developed high-fidelity prototypes focused on reducing barriers to support.

details.focus: Mental health stigma reduction, workplace wellbeing

title: Husky Hangout
description: Mobile app designed to help international students at University of Washington find community through shared interests. Conducted user interviews, created user flows, and designed interface focused on reducing social friction for new students navigating unfamiliar campus culture.

title: MiniJava Compiler
description: Developed full compiler for MiniJava (Java subset) using Java. Implemented lexical analysis with JFlex, syntax parsing with CUP tools, Abstract Syntax Tree traversal for type checking, and code generation targeting x86 assembly language. Demonstrates understanding of language design and compiler architecture.

title: Programming Language Interpreter
description: Built custom programming language interpreter in Racket, demonstrating language design principles and functional programming concepts. Implemented lexical scoping, first-class functions, and core language features through recursive evaluation.

title: Pacman AI Agent
description: Implemented AI algorithms including BFS, DFS, and A* for pathfinding and decision-making in Pacman environment. Developed heuristics for optimal ghost avoidance and pellet collection strategies.
